body:
Done by Korhiper on deviantart. Obviously inspired by the elderwood series, and i agree with the artist; he needs a buff. And some newly made love. 
When was the last time someone has seen a very serious {{champion:9}} in game? Not as much as we use to, community.

LETS BRING HIM BACK PLOX.

Edit: Guys, this IS just a "Concept" So changes will have to be made to avoid copying it too directly, especially since riot doesn't want fiddle to look TOO much like {{champion:120}}, theme wise. In my opinion, since Fiddle-dee, Fiddle-dum has a wonderful Dark Candy skin (I want Thresh to have one..), maybe this can be a winter season concept? Or Autumn.."Y" as some of the comments have suggested.

so hear is the thing (actually just played some fiddle games) he is good but takes a lot of practice and good decision making.  he also needs someone on his team to be a beefy frontline ideally and aoe cc helps alot.  as i play him ive found that if all my lanes  lose, he cant singly carry a game, so dont feel bad if u cant make up for 2 or 3 losing lanes.  if you want any tips try lane ganking as him from lane brush with ur ult, it almost always nets a kill or sums. also when u use his ultimate dont immediately fear and drain them, chase them down and when they just get out of range or ur ult ends then fear and drain them.  also despite deathfire sounding good ive really liked stormraiders surge to guarantee you outrun anyone after u ult them.  and lastly rush lucidiy boots and dont build a jg enchant, just the upgraded smite of preference

also lategame fiddlesticks can kill a whole team with his ultimate which is always a nice plus if it gets there.

good luck with future games!

Just another question, if you don't mind. Why not build a jungle enchantment? I hear how runeglaive isn't good on {{champion:9}} but reading what it does it sounds pretty good, since it gives mana restoration, and some CDR and mana. Do you mind explaining?

not a problem, and the reason is somewhat unfortunate in that fiddlesticks just needs hourglass far too much in order to take his time building the jg enchant.  i personally also run 15%cdr blue runes and use a build where i build the jg smite item and then get lucidity boots, then horuglass, then haunting guise then rylai then finish liandries.  also since i go deep enough into the cunning tree for storm raiders surge i also get the 5% cdr masteries which help with cdr a lot. the only issue with this build is u lack mana regen, which honestly sucks a ton but as fiddle u be greedy and unless ur mid is smashing the opponent you take every blue, and use the mastery that extends their duration.  also backing inbetween jungle clears is good cause otherwise u waste time walking around the jg.  mana regen is most important if u poke a lot and are in long fights/seiges. fiddle doesnt poke and rather instead just bides his time looking for a good ult.  fiddlesticks after his ult either dies or your team wins the fight relatively quickly due to its raw dmg, so teamfights with a fiddle never last long.  late game i might sell the smite enchant and pick up a morellonomicon, although ive been liking getting the support item so that fiddlesticks doesnt have to facecheck bushes since he dies if he is unlucky, although everyone calls me troll when i buy it unfortunately

and alas this all from me watching pros on twitch and youtube, and my own limited experience so take it with a grain of salt

I disagree.  A Rioter once said something to the effect that for skins they enjoy "skins that are an alternate interpretation of the champion.  Skins that provide an alternative fantasy or explore a new or different aspect of the character".  This skin idea does that wonderfully; it provides an alternative reality for Fiddlesticks, one were he appears to be a tranquil spirit of the forest.
It is far different from Elderwood Hecarim when we look at the details.
http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/5/59/Hecarim_ElderwoodSkin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20151119055536
Elderwood Hecarim is a gigantic Stag, taking form as a centaur-like spirit wearing stone ruins as barding, towering in presence, an ominous being great and terrible, threatening the power of nature.

Elderwood FIddlesticks looks entirely different.  He looks organic, not looking constructed like Fiddlesticks normally does but appearing entirely as if he was grown, formed from wood that has spread and twisted together, that has grown over and collected what has surrounded it, like how plants actually do, reclaiming it for the forest.  It looks like as if he has just developed from the growth of a flourishing tree, like a kind of Dryad of an Elderwood tree.
  It's not just that this splash looks amazing but this is a wonderful idea for a departure from how Fiddlesticks is usually portrayed, providing an interesting "alternative fantasy" for the champion.  It would be a shame to scrap this idea for only a one-note "creepy" interpretation of Elderwood, a niche that he already has good representation, just because it shares the palette of Elderwood Hecarim while Elderwood Bard doesn't.
